description:
For more than a century, MSD has been a global health care leader working to help the world be well. MSD is known as Merck & Co in the United States and Canada. Through our prescription medicines, vaccines, biologic therapies and animal health products, we work with customers and operate in more than 140 countries to deliver innovative health solutions. We also demonstrate our commitment to increasing access to healthcare through far-reaching policies, programs and partnerships. 


Whatever your career path - whether it's using your commercial and scientific flair, working directly with our customers, exploring ways to generate appropriate access to our medicines or supporting our business in another way - MSD offers opportunities to develop and expand your career while making a true difference in people's lives. At MSD, you'll find rewarding opportunities, diverse experiences and an unwavering commitment to ethics and integrity. As part of our team, you'll collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues whose sense of purpose complements your own.

Diversity & Inclusion

We are proud to be endorsed as an Employer for Women by DCC and named an Employer of Choice of Gender Equality (2015 and 2016) by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency, recognising our commitment to achieving gender equality in our workplace. MSD has a long-standing commitment to creating an organisation that is more diverse, and a culture that is inclusive and socially responsible. Having a more global and diverse workforce makes us a more innovative and agile company and better attuned to the needs of our customers, health care providers and patients who ultimately use our products.

A Diversity & Inclusion Council, chaired by the Managing Director, Australia and New Zealand, was established in 2014 to define, develop and drive diversity and inclusion strategies across the business.

The council’s vision is for all MSD employees to experience a workplace that respects and values diversity and inclusion. MSD is committed to focusing on gender equality and unconscious bias as primary focus areas. MSD is committed to having gender on the agenda and proactively taking action to identify and address barriers that prevent people entering and progressing in our organisation. Mental health and culture/origin are focus areas for awareness and education.

Here are some of our key current initiatives:

  • Membership of and contribution to diversity networks.
  • A leading flexible workplace culture supported by a comprehensive policy offering and the activity-based work environment at our head office in Sydney. Read about our best practice case study featured by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency here
  • Training and other methods to cultivate mental health awareness.
  • The highlighting and celebrating of key diversity events including A Taste of Harmony, Close the Gap, International Women’s Day and R U OK? Day.
  • The provision of exceptional benefits for caregivers, including parental leave and additional leave that can be used flexibly.

​

Diversity and inclusion are integrated into and are considered an essential leadership skill for all of our employees.

We expect all employees, beginning with our leaders, to achieve diversity and inclusion goals, which are used to gauge individual and company performance. We define, measure and reward diversity performance through a number of tools, including action plans and diversity objectives on our company scorecard.

  • The provision of exceptional benefits for care givers, including parental leave and additional leave that can be used flexibly.
  • Introduced additional paid leave to support employees requiring support for domestic/family violence leave.
  • Encouraging membership of a global network for women and men, a forum for people to connect with others to foster gender equality, build networks and talent, and act as a business resource group.
  • Actively promoting flexible work arrangements, with 9 in 10 employees saying they have the flexibility they need to manage work and caring responsibilities.
  • Bringing in external experts to give workshops and training.
  • Holding annual gender pay equity reviews that closed the company-wide pay gap by 50 per cent in one year, from 2014 to 2015.
  • A leading flexible workplace culture supported by a comprehensive policy offering and the activity-based work environment at our head office in Macquarie Park. 
  • The highlighting and celebrating of key diversity events including A Taste of Harmony, Close the Gap, International Women’s Day and R U OK? Day.
  • Membership of and contribution to diversity networks.
  • Training and other methods to cultivate mental health awareness
  • Hosted a landmark Pharmaceutical Pay Equity CEO roundtable in 2015.

MSD’s Managing Director, Australia and New Zealand, Riad El-Dada, took the Pay Equity Pledge in 2016, aligning to our organisational commitment to gender equality:

“Initiating and maintaining gender pay equity in the workplace should be one of the priorities for all leaders. MSD started this journey in 2013 and under my leadership, achieving gender pay equity will be front and centre for myself, my leadership team and for all people managers at MSD. It makes perfect sense for our people and for our business that we continue on this journey that we are proud to be on. Gender pay equity is in my hands, and it’s in your hands too.” 

Total Rewards

Total Rewards at MSD is comprised of various programs, designed to recognise and reward different aspects of your performance. Our Total Rewards philosophy is to provide employees with a competitive, comprehensive and integrated package of compensation and benefits that support our combined businesses, as well as a range of employee needs.

Total Remuneration - determined by labour market relativities, an employee’s sustained performance over time, as well as the development of skills, knowledge and abilities.

Variable Pay– where applicable, an incentive payment that rewards performance through the achievement of specific goals and objectives, which may include company, division, and individual results,

Long-Term Incentives - equity-based incentives, such as restricted stock  units, that recognise employees' future potential for significant contribution to the company.

Live. Work. Play.

Our benefits are designed to make life healthier and happier because we recognise the importance of work-life balance. At MSD, we support our employees in getting the most out of their lives, both personal and professional.

Reward Yourself Program – employees receive three "Reward Yourself Days" per calendar year once they reach six months service. Reward yourself days are additional discretionary leave days granted above and beyond other leave entitlements and provisions. Reward Yourself Days are an opportunity for colleagues to reward themselves and take the extra time to relax, recharge and re-energise.

Volunteering Policy – employees are eligible – and actively encouraged - to give back to the community. Employees can volunteer up to 40 hours of their time during regular working hours (over the course of a year) toward Company-approved activities at external, non-profit organisations.

Flexible Work Arrangements – with manager approval, flexible work schedules and arrangements to help employee's balance life's responsibilities.

Education Assistance – financial support for higher education is available for eligible employees to cover costs such as of tuition, registration and other fees.

Medicines Subsidy Policy– employees are eligible for reimbursement of the cost of purchasing company products for themselves and their immediate family, to a capped amount per annum.

Purchased Annual Leave – employees may access the Purchased Annual Leave program once they reach twelve months service.

Additional Company Leave Day – a discretionary company leave day granted for the purposes of a company-wide holiday.

Paid Parental Leave – competitive paid parental leave for (maternity, paternity and adoption leave) is available for eligible employees, including the ability to access additional paid leave, such as approved accrued leave.

Employee Assistance Program – provides confidential professional assessment, referral, counselling and education services.

Employee Recognition Program – employee reward and recognition program promotes employee engagement and achievement supporting Company access.

Employee Referral Program – be rewarded for encouraging others in your network to join MSD.

Individual Development Plans – employee development that extends beyond a plan on a page.

Well-being program – designed to focus on employee well-being from the pillars of physical, emotional and financial well-being.

Supplier Diversity

At MSD, we believe a diverse supplier base helps us better understand and anticipate the needs of the people we serve. That is why we cast a wide net in search of talent, seeking qualified suppliers from all segments of the global community. Our local supplier diversity program includes Indigenous and women-owned business enterprises.

Interested in becoming an MSD supplier? 
We hold our suppliers to the same standards to which we hold our own employees. We expect our suppliers to: 

  • provide top-quality products and services along with the highest level of service.
  • demonstrate that they are proactive, innovative and able to think strategically.
